Job Description
Data Analyst - Financial Institutions (FI) / Insurance / eCommerce

Professional Services

Description As a Fraud Data Analyst, you??ll use data from the largest real-time fraud detection platform on the planet to craft solutions for our enterprise customers. Your experience with data analysis, investigating suspicious behaviour and providing new insights to customers will lead to immediate real-world impact in the form of increased profits, lower authentication friction, and reduced credential abuse.

You??ll leverage a real-time platform analysing billions of logins, payments, account openings and other events per month for our Fortune 500 customers in Financial Services, Insurance, eCommerce, and On-Demand Services. These tools will allow you to attain a unique perspective of the Internet and every persona connected to it.

You??ll be continually collaborating with internal product and engineering teams, customer-facing account teams, and external business leaders and risk managers. The comprehensive policy you build will go head-to-head against some of the most motivated attackers in the world to protect billions in revenue.

Responsibilities:
??£ Review suspicious activity and complex fraud cases to help identify and resolve fraud risk trends and issues.
??£ Clearly and thoroughly document investigation findings and conclusions
??£ Understand how to write rules in ThreatMetrix decision engine and manage customer risk policy, leveraging hundreds of signals in the ThreatMetrix Digital Identity Network and data fed directly into the network by our customers.
??£ Offline analyses of customer data to tune rules, exposes patterns, research anomalies, reduce false positives, and build executive and project level reports.
??£ Identify meaningful insights from fraud data, such as chargebacks, account takeovers and social engineering events. Interpret and communicate findings from analysis to internal and external stakeholders.
??£ Collaboration with ThreatMetrix teams including Products, Engineering, and your colleagues to continually redefine best practices by enhancing tools, data sources, system functionalities, and fraud detection methods.
??£ Educate internal team members and external parties on processes and procedures.
??£ Demonstrate a professional and customer-centric persona when interacting directly with partners and customers via phone, e-mail, and chat.
??£ Risk and Technology consulting; sharing best practices with fraud managers, risk analysts, application developers, and project managers for combating persistent and emerging security threats.

Requirements Ideal Candidates:

??£ Minimum 3 years?? experience in fraud analytics in Financial Institutions (FI)/ECommerce or fraud vendor space.
??£ Ability to make decisions with limited and conflicting information.
??£ Solid knowledge of Card Not Present (CNP) environment, ACH, ACH Returns, Credit Card Chargebacks, Account Takeover Patterns, Login, Compromise.
??£ Strong SQL skills.
??£ Python/R skills 
??£ Fluency with data analysis and visualization tools (Arcadia or Tableau is a plus).
??£ Experience working with Rules Engines.
??£ A keen eye for detail, accuracy and strong critical thinking skills with advanced judgment capability.
??£ Extensive multi-tasking and prioritization skills needs to excel in fast paced environment with frequently changing priorities.

Job Description
Our client is a fast-paced start-up co-founded by successful entrepreneurs with the backing of key strategic investors in the video game industry. Client aims to work with popular online video games to improve player experience. Client is developing a scalable and secure data platform to process large amounts of game data and building systems to help detect various game and player events.
As the Data Engineering Lead, you will primarily grow and manage the data engineering team in region and work with other engineering teams to design and build data pipelines. You will collaborate closely with other Engineering Leads, Machine Learning Engineers, Architects, and Product teams to identify, build, test, and deploy data collection, management, and curation tools. You are also responsible for productionizing data manipulation and data management services. You will review requirements with Machine Learning Engineers, Product Managers and Analysts. You will work closely with Engineering Leads and Architects to ensure efficient use of resources and to help ensure proper integration with our broader cloud infrastructure.

We are seeking a talented data engineer lead to join our team. Your responsibilities as a data engineer lead will include:
- Recruiting and growing the data engineering team
- Managing and working directly with data engineers in region
- Overseeing overall tool development to add to our data platform
- Overseeing software engineering and the design of various data pipelines
- Working together with other engineering and product team leads and executives

What we are looking for:
- 5+ years of industry experience collecting data and building data pipelines
- Degree in Computer Science or related field
- Experience growing and managing a team of engineers
- Experience overseeing engineers and their execution towards team goals
- Experience with Python or relevant scripting language
- Experience with databases
- Experience building data pipelines from end to end:
o Understanding business use cases and requirements for different internal teams
o Prototyping initial collection and leveraging existing tools and/or creating new tools o Building and deploying scalable data pipelines for production
o Maintenance of such pipelines
- Experience working different types of datasets (e.g. unstructured, semi-structured, with missing information)
- Ability to think critically and creatively in a dynamic environment, while picking up new tools and domain
knowledge along the way
- A positive attitude, and a growth mindset
- Familiarity with different data stores (e.g. flat files, buckets, graph, columnar, NoSQL)
- Experience with Cloud infrastructure (e.g. AWS) and relevant microservices

Bonus:
- A passion for gaming =)
- Advanced Degree in Computer Science or related field
- Experience with open source data processing frameworks (e.g. Spark)
- Experience with relevant Python libraries such as Beautiful Soup, Requests, Scrapy, Selenium

Job Description
Job Purpose
AWS Data Architect will help lead our vision towards the democratizationof data within Cambridge University Press - so that data scientists, developers, or enthusiasts from any team can identify and access the data they need to answer questions, create reports, build services, or innovate.
He/She will join a cross-functional agile team as a data architect. Working with a Product Owner, data engineers, and internal technology teams. He/She will also manage and guide a team with at least two Data Engineers, or Data Scientists reporting directly to him/her. Further, your responsibility will be to adopt and build out an AWS suite of data technologies, and with the team to ensure good data integrity, security, management, governance and access.
He/She will help the business make data-driven decisions and put value at the fingertips of the entire organization.

Key Accountabilities
Develop and Maintain our Enterprise Data Lake
Develop and Maintain Data Pipelines
Develop and Maintain Data Warehousing

Job Description
JOB PURPOSE/MISSION/SUMMARY:

CDM Team is responsible for the collection, correction of errors in the CDM Portal, completeness and timeliness of channel reported data (sales out, inventory and retail reports) by doing analysis, validation and cleansing. This is a significant aspect for Lexmark to make sound decisions related to sales, accuracy in commissions, sales & marketing analysis and forecasting and rebates payout.
The data analyst collects data on product, material, customer, vendor, sales numbers, market research, logistics, or other behaviors. The role requires technical expertise to ensure the quality and accuracy of that data, then process, design and present it in ways to help people, businesses and organizations make better decisions.
KEY ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES / KEY JOB FUNCTIONS:

?? Understand that data are strategic business assets
?? Identify opportunities to transform-connect datasets to deliver business value added solutions
?? Mine and analyze data across databases to support process optimization / improvement
?? Operationalize the application of data to deliver optimized process thru world-class data and analytics governance
?? Deliver insightful information leveraging on the 3 expertise axes: business acumen, transactional and reporting tools
?? Build and implement data models through machine learning while making sure that accuracy and integrity of data is kept
?? Collaborates with the business teams to break data and organizational silos, thereby, solving rea-world problems faced by the organization and finding opportunities for improvement across projects, teams and business units.
?? Collaborates with the IT teams to leverage solution that would enable the teams to provide decision makers an intuitive, interactive, self-service environment that enables them to monitor business results, predict outcomes and drive action plans for optimal business performance
?? Setup of new reporting partners.  This includes the creation of the profile and the mapping of the data provided to the Global Template. The setup will involve working directly with the partners and country key users. 
?? Daily monitoring to verify the Partners reporting match what was expected. 
?? Conducts daily cleansing of data errors.  Errors can be solved through systematic research from available search engines, the MDM master data and SAP transactional data.  Analytical thinking is key in successful and efficient data cleansing ensuring relevant data coincides with each other from limited data sources.  In some situations, it will involve working directly with the partners and country key users. 
?? Timely escalation of identified data anomalies to Partners and Stakeholder
?? Ensure quick coordination and problem resolution of all CDM data issues. Timing is essential as it affects end user processes.
?? Timely review of data quality through Partner Scorecards reports and establish action plans to improve data collection.
?? Enrich reported data to correct and ensure accurate party and transaction data.
?? Conducts regular GT mapping audit and Serial number audit.
?? Conducts regular volume analysis identifying quantity fluctuations and conducts further investigation if there are abnormal increases/ decreases.
?? Conducts Monthly Business Review to the Business and Weekly Operations Call with CDM??s Global Process Owner

COMPETENCIES, SKILLS, KNOWLEDGE & ABILITIES:

?? Business Acumen
?? Analytical Skills
?? Technical Skills
?? Communication/Presentation Skills
?? Soft Skills
?? Customer Oriented
?? Lexmark Design Behaviors
?? Innovative
EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE & CERTIFICATIONS BASIC REQUIREMENTS:

?? Education: Preferably a graduate of Bachelor of Science, with focus on business related discipline and
Experience: Minimum 1 year relevant work experience.
Data Skills - General: ['validation', 'cleansing', 'logistics', 'Mine', 'analyze data across databases', 'business acumen', 'data models', 'machine learning', 'data cleansing']

DESCRIPTION OF WORK
Help manage transition related activities attributable to launches/relaunches to ensure minimal losses in support to the achievement of a satisfactory customer service.
Interact with the areas of Hub including Data Stewards, Data Quality and Technology teams to ensure delivery of efficient service.
Help review and assess together with MDM Assistant Manager SLA/KPIs and data issues.
Ensure timely release of KPI reports and other schedules.
Ensure tracking of all data objects and recording of all data issues and timelines
Support and help the alignment, sharing of best practices and benchmarking for MDM team.
Expected Work
Supports MDM Ops Information Analyst in collating and reporting MDM Key performance reports and sustains regionally-benchmarked KPI targets for MDM and drive action; monitors MDM KPIs and highlights sub-par performance or trends which put achievement of MDM team targets at risk.
A. Execution of Asia Hub planning model for Master Data Management Team and drives process efficiency and compliance of the business on agreed standards; recommends process improvements and sustainability plan to continuously improve business process.

B. Assist in ensuring adherence to the established processes and standards and enforce process compliance in own area of responsibility.
C. Assist MDM Governance Team in ensuring adherence to the Master??s Governing Policies including Data Quality Metrics and Data Cleansing activities.

E. Create and/or update the Item Master in the SAP R1P system after creation of master data and informs business of the code. Make sure all fields are filled up and maintained correctly based on the final Material Creation form.
F. Route the Master Recipe template and encode details in R1P. This is applicable to Multipacks (MPs) and Banded Packs (BPs) produced in 3P.
G. Interact with MDM Executives to enhance current business processes that will improve master data integrity and prevent maintenance issue from recurring.
H. Clean, consolidate and monitor data integrity based on Data Quality Metrics activity.
I. Record activities accomplished and issue logs for KPI and SLA purposes.
J. Raise concerns on data maintenance and processes involved to MDM Governance team and MDM Executive.
K. Provide support and leg work on master data ad hoc requirement
Work Experience
?? At least 2 years experience in implementation of SAP-MDM and/or SAP ECC
?? At least 2 years experience in any IT related areas
?? working experience in leading SAP data conversion and master data management
Skills Desired
?? Knowledgeable in implementation of various SAP data management strategies
?? Ability to work with Data standards to implement and support defined processes
?? Ability to translate business requirements into data conversion, data mapping and load specifications
?? Understanding of interfaces/mapping between SAP platforms
?? Demonstrate ability to work independently and balance multiple projects
?? Must have a full understanding of the Business Planning Models
?? Able to influence without authority
?? Good verbal and written communication skills
?? Good Analytical skills
?? Service oriented attitude
?? Good Negotiating Skills
?? Change catalyst
Education
Must be a college graudate. Bachelor??s degree in Sciences preferably in IT and Business courses is an advantage, but not a requirement.

Job Description
About the role:
We are looking for a collaborative, detail oriented and motivated Data Analyst to work closely with all business groups and regions. This role is responsible for the collation of environmental data analytics/reporting to support internal business management processes to aid in the carbon zero strategy. Working with all business functions the role will focus on collating, extracting, analysing and presenting business significant data to enhance our understanding of greenhouse gas emissions and other environmental data to facilitate alignment with our 2048 science based target.
You will work closely with the VP of Operations ensuring that maximum business value is extracted from all our data sources.

About you:
You will demonstrate our six behavioural values; collaborative, decisive, empowering, innovative, responsible and responsive as you work toward your goal. You will thrive working with multiple teams, offering excellent communication lines and a clear sense of direction.
You will be highly numerate, detail focused, collaborative and independent worker. You will have a high level of knowledge/capability with regard to data manipulation, data problem resolution and use of data tools and systems. Your documentation and communication style should be clear and concise.
Under direction and in collaboration with other teams you should have the ability to analyse multiple data sets and articulate outcomes and findings.
Principal Accountabilities
To assist across the Press with all data analysis activities ensuring that maximum business value is extracted from all our data sources. In particular, this role will:
Work to improve the accuracy and efficiency of data across the Press
Gain a comprehensive understanding of all data, its characteristics, manifestations and idiosyncrasies ensuring we continue to collect and retain all that is relevant in a fast changing landscape.
Gain a comprehensive understanding of all the systems and tools wherein this data resides, evaluate and assess their utility in an ongoing way and recommend developments to enhance our capabilities.
To fulfil business needs, develop new reports/analysis or existing outputs to give new insights into our business, for science-based targets, aligning to our 2048 target
Ensure that the analysis produced is presented and packaged in user friendly formats accessible to the non-technical.
Develop appropriate communication to ensure wide dissemination of data analysis outputs to help drive a more evidenced based approach
System superuser for BO/Cognos/WoS/Core usage data / other tools
Feed back to the business with recommendations for improved data acquisition, data handling best practice or process improvements
Stay informed about data analysis developments by identifying training needs and attending training sessions
Working across multiple zones with all key branches and SSO
We offer
Competitive Salary
Up to 33 days Paid Annual Leaves
HMO Coverage and Life Insurance on day 1
Vesting/Retirement package
Learning Opportunities
Flexible work arrangement

Job Description

What's in it for you?
 
Our Insights team has been collaboratively and individually recognized as leaders in the global communications evaluation industry. Due to our continued growth and success, we are looking for 1 Junior Research/Data Analyst  or Research/Data Analyst  to join our PH team. You will have the opportunity to:
Become part of a leading media intelligence team.
Have support from a great team of individuals who understand the media intelligence industry and always strive to improve.
Work with leading global brands.
Who are you?
A successful Junior Data /Research Analyst  or Research/Data Analyst has the ability to:
Scrutinize, analyze, organize media data whether news or social
Manage data from extraction down to visualization
Manage accounts based on agreed upon specifications and framework
Create visually appealing, consistent, and clean reports
He/she must:
Have a penchant for communications, public relations, news, and public opinion through social media
Have an eye for details
Have a strong commitment to data integrity and accuracy
Have an inherent interest in data visualization and data management techniques
Be able to work within a team but also strive to grow individually
The role:
Work under the guidance of the Research Manager as direct lead, Senior Research Manager, and Country Insights Lead to manage the daily schedule and plan for work optimization.
Ensure data management is completed with a high standard of quality based on the established measures.
Produce consistent output of data and reports with a high level of accuracy and in keeping with the account deadlines.
Provide support to the Insights Analysts and Researchers (in-house and outsource) in accessing, understanding, entering data and performing quality control checks.
Work on data visualization as per the established format of the reports but also go beyond the templates to ensure that the data presented are accurate and relevant.
Work on database and template maintenance as required.
Perform other duties as assigned by the Regional Insights Manager for Emerging Markets in Southeast Asia as direct vertical in the regional level with the goal of supporting the team.
 
Essentials:
Graduate in Communications Research, Mass Communications, Research, Statistics, Visual Communications, Communications Design, or any equivalent.
1-2 years of work experience as a researcher, analyst, or data visualizer OR a fresh graduate with the above-stated capabilities.
Professional command of the English language, both written and spoken
Proficient in Microsoft Office applications especially Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint (preferably with a working knowledge in using Power Pivot and Power BI), including Google Suite applications.
Strong analytical and data management skills (detail-oriented)
Ability to implement analysis projects
Strong interest in research and analytics
Must be willing to work in Ortigas
Must be able to start not later than November 23, 2020.
Desirables:
Proficient in using Advanced Microsoft Excel tools, including G-Suite
Data Analytics or Project management experience
Working knowledge of Adobe Illustrator, Tableau, or other visualization tools.
Personal Attributes:
Exceptionally self-motivated and directed
Patient and cordial but assertive
Ability to set and manage priorities judiciously
Ability to articulate ideas to both technical and non-technical audiences
Willing to learn and introduce new ideas
Recruitment process & Package:
Short-listed candidates will be required to undertake a diagnostics test on reading comprehension, grammar, excel skills test, and report visualization.
Candidates who aced the diagnostics tests will be invited for 1-2 interviews.
Regularization will be granted after successfully completing a 6 month probation period.
The role comes with a complete salary package, incentives, and HMO.

Job Description
Job Summary:
The Salesforce Data Analyst is responsible for analyzing and managing data within Salesforce that impacts global operation. This professional will work across multiple products, services and other teams to deliver prompt response to questions relating to operation implementations. The Data Analyst will analyze Salesforce data points for opportunities to accelerate the order backlog, coordinate communication with customers related to implementation, confirm month end activation and forecast, produce reporting on key performance metrics.
Responsibilities for this position include but are not limited to the following:
Proactively analyze backlog order data to identify opportunities to accelerate activations
Proactively manage forecast data across implementation teams to ensure accurate revenue is forecasted
Prepare operations reports for revenue, productivity and key performance metrics
Build Salesforce reports and dashboards as needed providing productivity, revenue and resource visibility
Demonstrate creativity, foresight and mature judgment in anticipating and solving complex problems
Create and maintain departmental documentation of all operational processes and procedures
Respond rapidly and accurately to internal and external customer requests delivered to high volume Inbox
Manage inquiries regarding order accuracy, scheduling status or resource assignments
Coordinate and advise management on resource assignments based on workload capacity reports
Collaborate with internal customers on projects to identify new business requirements that improve handoff processes
Identify and pursue continuous improvement of workflow processes to achieve maximum productivity
Assist with order completion and billing analysis required to deliver on audit requests
Maintain accurate records of all contact with external customers within Salesforce

Job Description
Do you crunch data for breakfast? Hungry for a data challenge? If yes, we want to talk to you. We are looking for data analysts with great talent and potential to join us! We are seeking experienced, energetic, and self-starting technologists to join the Data Cloud team. Our Data Cloud team is responsible for the our Identity Graph platform, which captures billions of behavioral, demographic, environmental, and transactional signals, for people-based marketing. As part of this team, the data analyst will be understanding how web behaviors correlate with user intent, building automated and detailed reporting systems and dashboards, and providing actionable insights for business strategy, product development and marketing operations.
RESPONSIBILITIES:
As a Senior Data Analyst, your responsibilities will include:
Interact with Prospect and Customer data to create impactful visualization and insight reports
Interact with potential partners to determine partnership value, data potential and go-forward plan
Understand our vast data sets and their main business uses and how to query them accurately
Identifying user segments from web traffic and user attribute data, and generate detailed performance reports for optimization
Owning a portion of the analytics request flow, prioritizing and responding to requests for insights from internal/external customers
Building and maintaining reports, dashboards, and metrics to further the maturity of our selfservice analytics capability
Optimizing queries and data flows on top of Snowflake/Hive/Athena/Vertica
Automating reports, dashboards and data flows
Understand the business objectives and provide recommendations on reports and insights to internal and external customers/partners
QUALIFICATIONS:
5+ years?? experience doing quantitative analysis, preferably for a consumer technology or digital media company
Experience using relational databases, very strong SQL skills
Knowledge of (or experience with) statistical packages for analyzing datasets (eg. R, Matlab/Octave, SciPy)
Data visualization and presentation skills, using tools like Looker or Tableau
Must be able to work at least 4 hours overlapping with Eastern Standard Time (9am-5pm)
Experience with large data sets and distributed computing (Snowflake/Hive/Hadoop/Spark) a plus
Experience with automating data workflows using Airflow, python a strong plus
Ability to initiate and drive projects to completion with minimal direction
Foundational understanding of statistical analysis
Strong written and oral communication skills. Comfortable working with internal and external stakeholders
IDEAL CANDIDATE: Understand business objectives, able to pull together various analysis to support the decision makers accurately and expeditiously, add their own color, analysis and recommendations and optimize and automate the reporting
Data Skills - General: ['reporting systems', 'visualization', 'insight', 'quantitative analysis', 'relational databases', 'Data visualization', 'presentation skills', 'statistical analysis', 'recommendations']

Job Description
Job Summary:
Workforce Analysts operate in a fast-paced environment. The position requires multitasking between analysis, real-time traffic monitoring and management reporting. Analysts will study call patterns and trend data to forecast call volume and calculate staffing requirements. They partner with Training and Operations Teams to schedule ongoing and periodic employee development sessions. Analysts are also involved in real-time monitoring of CMS and WFM tools to ensure service level agreements are met. Analysts will communicate significant changes or events to the Workforce Manager.
Role / Responsibilities:             
Responsible to follow daily change-management practices to accurately document absenteeism and events impacting Operations.             
Responsible to communicate effectively with management any significant protocol breaches and technical issues impacting center performance.             
Report center metrics hourly to management by email and significant events promptly by phone.             
Effectively communicate any operational problems or concerns to the Workforce Manager.             
Workforce Analysts are responsible for training Operations Teams on use of WFM client applications and fielding questions from Team Leaders.             
Utilizing skills in MS Office suite applications, WFM applications and other contact center tools to perform daily responsibilities and complete projects.             
Providing custom reporting to the Operations Manager to drive center KPIs and uncover call-avoidance issues.             
Researching attendance and performance issues for HR and Operations Manager when required.             
             
Required Skills / Qualifications / Knowledge / Experience:             
High School Diploma             
At least one year of experience in fast-paced contact-center environment             
Strong analytical and communications skills.             
Intermediate capabilities in MS Office suite applications.             
Ability to work extended hours when needed; consistent non-traditional hours required             
Advanced capabilities in MS Office suite applications             
Demonstrated English proficiency both verbally and written             
Experience in Finance/Accountancy is a plus             
Flexibility to work overtime and on weekends

Job Description
Job Summary:
The Implementation Services Representative I is responsible for converting client data into RealPage products and systems.  Using established procedures, the ISR I is required to analyze client data and take the appropriate actions necessary to implement all requested products.  This can include working with files in a variety of formats, including Excel, PDF, and hardcopies of files.  Phone and email communication with clients will also be required throughout the implementation process.
ISR candidates are expected to master the skills required to implement at least one primary Leasing & Rents product center, which are Conventional, HUD (Section 8), and Tax Credit (LIHTC) based properties.  The implementation of ancillary products, such as Facilities, Purchasing, and Affordable Waitlist will also be required.
Responsibilities for this position include but are not limited to the following:
Develop mastery of the conversion tools required to successfully implement RealPage products and services
Manipulate client submitted materials into a format useable by RealPage Conversion Utilities
Review client business practices and confirm data is converted in a way that best utilizes RealPage products
Complete accurate manual entry of data, from multiple sources, as required by the implementation process
Analyze reports produced through the implementation process to identify and make corrections as necessary
Confirm the results of the implementation process fulfill client expectations prior to completing each service
Document issues encountered through the implementation process using account management tools, such as Salesforce
Review complex orders and Statements of Work to confirm that all services being provided have been properly requested
Perform peer review of the work produced by teammates to ensure it meets department quality standards
Communicate with clients to resolve complex issues with their submitted conversion materials, as required
Meet strict deadlines and manage multiple projects within a short time frame
Communicate with management regarding the status of assignments and any obstacles encountered that may hinder the achievement of designated goals
interested applicants should be amenable to work on Night shift
minimum of 10 mbps for a temporary work from home arrangement

Job Description
Job Summary:
The role of the Business Analyst is designed to provide direct engagement support to assigned transformation initiatives (i.e. low to mid complexity projects). The role entails working closely with key stakeholders and subject matter experts to elicit detailed requirements as well as capture essential business needs. The role will also manage the delivery of requirements by participating in design reviews (i.e. with IT team) and walk-throughs to communicate design changes (i.e. with systems) and validate the proposed solutions.
Key Responsibilities:
Ensure successful execution of requirements management activities throughout the project lifecycle.       
Engage with project owners and key stakeholders to elicit the proper scope requirements.       
Manage day to day responsibility of monitoring project requirements from analysis to implementation.        
Assist the business in vendor assessment to prepare for the request for proposal and actively participate in the vendor's proof of concept. Implement decision and evaluation analysis in selecting the most suitable vendor.        
Facilitate effective business requirements analysis discussions and walk through sessions with key  stakeholders from both the business and implementation teams in defining the solution.        
Validate solutions through user acceptance tests including data migration rules, business rules and other related deliverables. Ensure defects are resolved, mitigated, and actioned.  
Provide regular status reporting for requirements management activities for alignment across multiple stakeholders.       
Facilitate and negotiate requirements discussions with key stakeholders.        
Create end user documentation; conduct user trainings, and provide on-site support.
Process:
With the Enchance Community Quaratine, all Interview/s will be done via Phone call/ Video Con-Call
Job Offers will be Virtually Presented

Job Description:
Job Description
The ETL Developer / Data Integration Engineer in the Marketing Data Team at RingCentral will empower the Marketing organization with processes, metrics, tools and technologies to deliver world-class data infrastructure enabling a highly data-driven business. You will collaborate with both the Marketing, Global Operations and IT teams to deliver and contribute to strategic solutions designed to meet and support the entire Marketing portfolio.
The ideal candidate is proactive, has excellent communication skills, enjoys working as part of a team, can successfully multi-task, and thrives on being successful in high stress environments. Successful candidates will have strong interpersonal skills, a confident presence, excellent logical troubleshooting skills, strong project management skills and the ability to manage cross-functional teams.
Responsibilities:
?? Driving data hygiene initiatives through analyzing, cleansing, verifying and on some occasions enriching various forms of data to ensure accurate reporting for the Marketing and Global Operations team.
?? Building integrations and automations that enable marketing campaigns to be more targeted, dynamic and highly personalized.
?? Monitoring existing data workflows to ensure both high availability and prompt response time to any stakeholder concerns.
?? Establishing a data monitoring tool to ensure we have a high level of data accuracy from different systems and get ahead of potential escalations relating to data discrepancies.
?? Providing technical support for any data related inquiries within Salesforce, Marketo and Hadoop.
?? Builds credibility and establishes a collaborative rapport with key stakeholders within the organization.
?? Drives continuous process improvement and standards development.
Must-Have:
?? Experience in driving continuous improvement with a track record of achieving results.
?? Three to five years of relevant development work experience in the same field is required for this position.
?? Strong process orientation.
?? Ideal candidate is familiar with at least one of these technologies: Salesforce, Marketo, Tableau, Talend, Alteryx, Hadoop, and a strong user of MS Office, especially Excel.
?? Ability to work, lead, and achieve results in a global environment.
?? Self-starter/action-oriented: Can identify opportunities for process improvement
?? Demonstrated ability to work as a team player and enjoys collaboration.
?? Demonstrated ability to work with minimal supervision.
?? Demonstrated ability to work with attention to detail.
?? Demonstrated excellence in troubleshooting and analysis skills.
?? Naturally inquisitive and committed to continuous learning improvement.
?? Willingness to work in a fast-paced organization.
?? Must be a highly energetic individual and a motivated team player.
Qualifications:
?? BS or MS IT or equivalent experience.
?? 2-4 years of experience in ETL Development
Nice-To-Have:
?? Basic to intermediate experience with Java Programming.
?? Experience in building, deploying, analyzing and iterating on complex ETL integrations
?? Experience working with APIs and parsing XML or JSON formatted data outputs.
Benefits and Amenities:
?? Centrally located in Shaw Boulevard, Mandaluyong City (close to MRT Shaw Station and EDSA)
?? Work from home temporarily until January 3, 2021, or until further notice
?? Comprehensive HMO Package (medical, dental)
?? Personal Time Off Leaves
?? Quarterly Performance Incentive
?? Discounted Gold's Gym Membership
